intro: [WRONG START] Pharbitis livens, commonly known as morning glory. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions and is known for its rapid growth and vibrant, often colorful blooms. Its leaves are heart-shaped and alternate along the stems, while the seeds are enclosed in a spiral-shaped capsule. Pharbitis livens is also noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
